bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 117 (Monday, July 10, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. MACE:H.R. 4502.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, clause 3 and Article I, Section 8,clause 18The single subject of this legislation is:Reforming Federal Cyber Workforce Hiring Requirements[Page H3177]

item.text: Ordered to be Reported in the Nature of a Substitute (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 40 - 0.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held
Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability.

item.title: H.R. 4502, Modernizing the Acquisition of Cybersecurity Experts Act of 2023
item.description: As ordered reported by the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability on July 12, 2023

bill.title: Modernizing the Acquisition of Cybersecurity Experts Act

item.title: Modernizing the Acquisition of Cybersecurity Experts Act
Modernizing the Acquisition of Cybersecurity Experts Act
To amend title 5, United States Code, to allow Federal agencies to establish educational requirements for certain cybersecurity positions in the competitive service, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Ordered to be Reported in the Nature of a Substitute (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 40 - 0.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
